column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: REA Group's standard form supplier agreements include appropriate modern slavery clauses requiring suppliers to comply with the REA Group Code of Conduct, take reasonable steps to identify, assess and address risks of modern slavery practices in their operations and supply chains and promptly remediate any harm to impacted individuals which is uncovered as a result of these due diligence processes. Where REA Group is contracting on a supplier's standard contract terms, REA Group will negotiate appropriate modern slavery clauses where the supplier meets REA Group's risk criteria.
column20: Modern slavery clause, supplier agreement, modern slavery practice

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: All significant supplier engagements need a Contract Approval Form to accompany the contract agreement and require approval from Procurement, Risk, Finance and Legal, in addition to Executive Leadership sign-off.
column20: Contract Approval Form, supplier agreement, approval

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: REA's supplier governance approach ensures management oversight of REA's relationships with suppliers by enforcing policies and strategies to ensure that compliance, performance, and ethical business practices are being met.
column20: Supplier governance, management governance, supplier

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: In FY23, REA partnered with Supply Nation, a non-profit organisation that aims to grow the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander business sector by promoting supplier diversity in Australia. Supply Nation is a database of verified Indigenous businesses and allows REA's people to select Indigenous suppliers with confidence. It will evolve through REA's RAP work as it expands the use of Supply Nation in a more sustainable and integrated way.
column20: Supply Nation, supplier diversity, Indigenous business

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: In FY2021 and FY2022, REA Group's central procurement team completed ethical procurement and supply training provided online by the Chartered Institute of Procurement & Supply. Eleven members of the procurement team have completed this training since FY2021. This important step was taken to ensure that REA Group procurement personnel can recognise indicators of modern slavery practices and that REA Group can address the risk that it could contribute to modern slavery practices through unrealistic expectations about the price or delivery timeframes to be met by suppliers.
column20: Ethical Procurement Training, central procurement team, modern slavery practice

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: In FY2022, REA India incorporated an interactive modern slavery training module into its annual compliance refresher course. During the year, 1,284 employees of REA India completed the training. REA Group Australia intends to implement a similar module into annual compliance training and new employee onboarding in FY2023.
column20: Modern slavery training module, compliance refresher module, employee onboarding

Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's Cyber Security Policy aims to ensure that information can be used when required in business with the confidence that it is accurate and complete and adequately protected from misuse, unauthorised disclosure, damage or loss. The policy sets out the minimum acceptable security objectives to help REA Group meet its risk appetite.
column20: Cyber Security Policy, unauthorised disclosure, security objective

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's data privacy research shows that 90% of its consumers prefer to deal with companies that treat data privacy as important. As a business, REA proactively opted to make privacy-focused decisions that exceed current privacy regulations and meet consumer expectations.
column20: Data privacy research, data privacy, privacy-focused decision

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's user data deletion requests increased significantly as the public reacted and acted over the use and retention of their personal information. As a result, REA further examines its data retention periods and invests in systems to deal with consumer requests more efficiently.
column20: Data retention period, data deletion request, personal information

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: In FY23, REA embedded proactive privacy settings in its solution architecture and technical designs to capture and store users' declared data and make it easier to align with data security and retention policies.
column20: Proactive privacy settings, solution architecture, data security

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's Privacy Policy outlines what information it collects, how it uses it, stores it and discloses it, and how REA gives users as much control over their personal information as possible.
column20: Privacy Policy, control, personal information

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's FY23 annual compliance refresher training is mandatory for all employees and includes a module on 'ensuring data privacy'. This module achieved a 100% completion rate in FY23.
column20: Compliance refresher training, data privacy, employee

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: This year, project teams audited all APIs, and REA deployed a Cloud Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP). Additionally, REA increased its cyber security team with a dedicated Application Security capability, new for 2023.
column20: API audits, Cloud Native Application Protection Platform, Application Security Capability

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's cyber security strategy remains consistent and has been independently assessed by Deloitte. REA's cyber security priority areas are supported by principles that guide decision-making for REA's security roadmap. REA's cyber security teams leverage the Objectives and Key Results goal-setting framework (OKRs), reporting REA's progress to executive stakeholder groups and risk committees.
column20: Cyber security strategy, cyber security priority area, security roadmap

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA prioritises upfront security integration in products and technology, not post-development. REA's Product Security Health Check (PSHC) enables self-assessment by product managers. REA's teams use PSHC story cards in their product delivery roadmaps to meet cyber security policy requirements and avoid unnecessary delays.
column20: Product Security Health Check, security integration, product manager

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA's products and services are the subject of security assurance activities. It includes secure code scanning for REA's most critical systems and assessments by a panel of penetration testing partners who 'ethically hack' its software in search of security vulnerabilities.
column20: Security assurance, secure code scanning, security vulnerability

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA is an annual participant in Safer Internet Day. This year, REA encouraged its employees to connect safely and purposefully, keeping apps and devices secure and using social media positively. REA also encourages employees to reflect before acting by taking a moment to consider how what they do and say online may affect others.
column20: Safer Internet Day, employee, social media

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Digital risk management is essential to proactively identify, assess, and mitigate potential threats and vulnerabilities to REA and its customers. During FY23, REA took down 45 malicious mobile apps and 34 fake websites (a 20% year-on-year increase) related to phishing, social media, and brand abuse. It was achieved by leveraging a combination of certificate transparency monitoring and phishing takedown services from a leading digital risk management partner.\t
column20: Digital risk management, vulnerability, transparency monitoring

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column8: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance Policy
column13: REA maintains a Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance (DMARC) policy for its outbound marketing campaigns, providing confidence that messages originate from and are digitally signed by REA Group.
column20: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance Policy, marketing campaign, digital signing

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA values the security research community for making online safety possible. REA's Responsible Disclosure Policy is available on its corporate website and outlines how researchers can report vulnerabilities safely and responsibly.
column20: Responsible Disclosure Policy, the security research community, online safety

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA expresses its appreciation for its Responsible Vulnerability Disclosure Program Hall of Fame, where REA thanks and recognises security researchers for participating in its responsible disclosure program.
column20: Responsible Vulnerability Disclosure Program Hall of Fame, appreciation, security researcher

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA regularly conducts simulated phishing campaigns to continually improve its response to similar security events that may impact its staff. REA's employees also share examples of phishing messages they have received to learn from each other.
column20: Simulated phishing, security event, phishing message

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Phishing-resistant authentication is becoming increasingly important due to the weaknesses in multi-factor authentication (MFA) that are now beginning to be exploited at scale. REA is assessing how a new standard called FIDO2 (Fast Identity Online) compliant authentication will increase protection against credential-based attacks. REA implemented enhanced authentication for high-risk users.
column20: FIDO2, phishing-resistant authentication, MFA

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Supply chain attacks are expected to continue in breadth and impact. Implementing practical solutions for addressing software update corruption at scale poses challenges for organisations. REA implemented multi-cloud security tools to understand its software supply chain better and reduce the time to detect vulnerabilities that could impact its environment.
column20: Multi-cloud security tool, software update corruption, vulnerability

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Browser plugins are commonly used legitimately in corporate workplaces; however, they are also leveraged by attackers for wide-scale breaches. Traditional security and monitoring tools do not provide sufficient coverage for detecting malicious plugins; therefore, REA is exploring further potential mitigations. REA implements software management controls to manage software installation within the REA Group better.\t
column20: Software management control, browser plugin, software installation

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: REA Group continually assess itself against trusted industry benchmarks. With the purchase of the Mortgage Choice organisation, a work program was delivered to improve the security outcomes of the business. This program focused on aligning the existing Mortgage Choice security control environment to REA Group and has led to significant improvements in security maturity across all five domains of the NIST Cyber Security Framework.
column20: Mortgage Choice security, NIST Cyber Security Framework, security maturity
